---428485804-766235113-1359642374=:16402
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=utf-8
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

Hello, me again!

Sorry for spamming, this will surely be the last mail for=
 today. Promise! :)

The problem is now pinned down. The troublemaker is a =
redirect in the link to the css file. The source code links to ..../web/det=
ail.php?template=3Dhp3_style. Then there's a redirect to .../sixcms/detail.=
php?template=3Dhp3_style. If I change the source code locally to the right =
path, the site works fine.

Is there any chance for Heritrix to get this ri=
ght automatically? My value of MaxTransHops is already 3, so this shouldn't=
 be problematic.

Steph




________________________________
 Von: Steph <s=
herlock.h221b@...>
An: "archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com" <archive-cra=
wler@yahoogroups.com>; "nlevitt@..." <nlevitt@...> 
Gesende=
t: 12:48 Donnerstag, 31.Januar 2013
Betreff: Re: [archive-crawler] Problem =
with CSS
 

=C2=A0 
Hello again!

After further investigation I am now able=
 to pinpoint the issue more exactly. This morning I experimentally undid th=
e rewritings of the urls in my archived page. And was surprised to see it w=
ork smoothly. I found out that the problem seems to lie in the css files or=
 the rewriting of the links to the css files. When I undo these rewrites th=
e site comes up perfectly. But I think this isn't the best solution as I st=
ill rely on the css files on the liveweb and not on my archived sites and f=
iles.

Maybe this helps to get a little further?

Steph




_______________=
_________________
 Von: Steph <sherlock.h221b@...>
An: Noah Levitt <n=
levitt@...>; "archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com" <archive-crawler@yah=
oogroups.com> 
Gesendet: 9:44 Donnerstag, 31.Januar 2013
Betreff: Re: [arch=
ive-crawler] Problem with CSS
 

=C2=A0 
Hello Noah!

Thanks for your reply=
!

Yes, I use Wayback Machine Beta for replaying it.

Like you said, I did =
a check for broken links this morning (using Xenu link sleuth) and now I'm =
really confused. Due to the tests I did I got several archived versions of =
the said website. In some cases Xenu says everything is alright, in other c=
ases he reports an issue concerning a file named index.jsp because of serve=
r error (500) or (in other cases) page not found (404).

I tried to find th=
e jsp file to take a look at it, but it won't show up anywhere. Neither in =
the live web version nor in my archived version... But Xenu finds an empty =
url almost every time .


Steph





________________________________
 Von:=
 Noah Levitt <nlevitt@...>
An: archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com 
CC:=
 Steph <sherlock.h221b@...> 
Gesendet: 23:41 Mittwoch, 30.Januar 2013=

Betreff: Re: [archive-crawler] Problem with CSS
 
Hello Steph,

Are you re=
playing your crawled content using wayback?

You need to zero in on the iss=
ue. Browsers these days have a way to view all the requests and responses a=
s they go by (web console/net in firefox, developer tools/network in chrome=
, etc.) Open your url in wayback and look for 404s or other anomalies. When=
 you
 see something is missing then you can try to figure out why. If you d=
on't see anything missing at least you've narrowed it down and can continue=
 investigating elsewhere.

Noah


On 2013-01-30 02:14 , Steph wrote:
>
>
> =
Hi everyone!
>
> I'm new to this group and new to web archiving.
>
> I'm st=
udying Media Preservation and for a project I try to save a few websites us=
ing Heritrix. It generally works really fine.
>
> But some websites really =
give me a headache, because the layout won't work. The images are all there=
, the Css files are also saved, but it won't show the defined frames! The c=
ontent is just lined up, one below the other, instead of beneath or above e=
ach other.
>
> I already raised the number of MaxTransHops and SpeculativeH=
ops and it worked for a number of websites, but not for this.
>
> One of th=
e websites is http://www.landesarchiv-bw.de.
>
> Maybe you can give me some=
 advice?
> It would be very appreciated!
>
> Thanks in advance,
>
> Steph
>=

>
>
>
